message_1:
Calculate the correlation coefficient between the heights (in inches) and weights (in pounds) of 10 individuals. The data is given below:

| Height (in) | Weight (lbs) |
|-------------|--------------|
|     68      |     150      |
|     72      |     180      |
|     64      |     130      |
|     70      |     160      |
|     65      |     120      |
|     67      |     140      |
|     69      |     160      |
|     71      |     170      |
|     66      |     130      |
|     70      |     180      |
message_2:
To calculate the correlation coefficient (r), we will first find the mean of both height and weight, then calculate the covariance, standard deviation of height and weight, and finally use the formula r = covariance / (standard deviation of height * standard deviation of weight).

Mean of height (x̄) = (68 + 72 + 64 + 70 + 65 + 67 + 69 + 71 + 66 + 70) / 10 = 672 / 10 = 67.2
Mean of weight (ȳ) = (150 + 180 + 130 + 160 + 120 + 140 + 160 + 170 + 130 + 180) / 10 = 1520 / 10 = 152

Now, let's calculate the covariance:
Σ[(xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ)] / (n - 1)
= [(68-67.2)(150-152) + (72-67.2)(180-152) + (64-67.2)(130-152) + (70-67.2)(160-152) + (65-67.2)(120-152) + (67-67.2)(140-152) + (69-67.2)(160-152) + (71-67.2)(170-152) + (66-67.2)(130-152) + (70-67.2)(180-152)] / 9
= [-0.2(-2) + 4.8(28) + (-3.2)(-22) + 2.8(8) + (-2.2)(-32) + (-0.2)(-12) + 1.8(8) + 3.8(18) + (-1.2)(-22) + 2.8(28)] / 9
= [0.4 + 134.4 + 70.4 + 22.4 + 70.4 + 2.4 + 14.4 + 68.4 + 26.4 + 78.4] / 9
= 487.6 / 9
= 54.18 (approx.)

Now, let's calculate the standard deviation of height and weight:
Standard deviation of height (σx) = √[Σ(xi - x̄)² / (n - 1)]
= √[(68-67.2)² + (72-67.2)² + (64-67.2)² + (70-67.2)² + (65-67.2)² + (67-67.2)² + (69-67.2)² + (71-67.2)² + (66-67.2)² + (70-67.2)²] / 9
= √[0.64 + 23.04 + 10.24 + 7.84 + 4.84 + 0.04 + 3.24 + 14.44 + 1.44 + 7.84] / 9
= √[73.52] / 9
= √[8.17] (approx.)
= 2.86 (approx.)

Standard deviation of weight (σy) = √[Σ(yi - ȳ)² / (n - 1)]
= √[(150-152)² + (180-152)² + (130-152)² + (160-152)² + (120-152)² + (140-152)² + (160-152)² + (170-152)² + (130-152)² + (180-152)²] / 9
= √[4 + 784 + 484 + 64 + 1024 + 144 + 64 + 324 + 484 + 784] / 9
= √[4160] / 9
= √[462.22] (approx.)
= 21.5 (approx.)

Finally, let's calculate the correlation coefficient (r):
r = covariance / (standard deviation of height * standard deviation of weight)
= 54.18 / (2.86 * 21.5)
= 54.18 / 61.47 (approx.)
= 0.88 (approx.)

The correlation coefficient between the heights and weights of the 10 individuals is approximately 0.88, which indicates a strong positive correlation.
